critique: This document is an amendment to a previous executive order regarding the Federal Alcohol Control Administration. It primarily deals with the appointment of members to the administration. Given the context of the time (post-Prohibition era), the establishment of such an administration suggests a move towards regulating the alcohol industry. However, the document itself is very specific and administrative in nature, focusing on personnel. It doesn't directly address broader ideological issues, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral. The economic regulation axis leans slightly towards intervention due to the nature of alcohol control.
